author: Ramy Zabarah
title: 11 Crosswind Landings That Scream 'Nope'
text:
11 Crosswind Landings That Scream 'Nope' Popular Mechanics 6 days ago Ramy Zabarah Flying is already one of the most nerve-wracking modes of transportation available—and if you've ever been in a plane that's had to land in crosswind, then you've felt true horror.​
Crosswind is any type of wind that blows perpendicular to the runway, which makes landing even harder than it already is. In order to safely touch down on the runway, a pilot must turn the airplane sideways to compensate. Scary, right?
Here are a few examples of planes landing (or attempting to land) in severe crosswind. Get that in-flight drink ready now.​
First up, the "I can totally do this—nope just kidding let's try that again" landing:​
© YouTube Next, the " please don't let me die in Bimingham " landing:
© YouTube/bristolcardifairport Here's take two of this gut-wrenching landing of a Condor Boeing 757 in Düsseldorf, Germany:
© YouTube/Cargospotter Another close call , this time in a gargantuan Emirates 777:
© YouTube/flugsnug Seriously, never go to Birmingham :
© YouTube/flugsnug 75-mph winds couldn't stop this Boeing 777 from touching down in Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport:
© YouTube/17splinter When you're ready for the ground, but the ground just isn't ready for you ​:
© YouTube/Elktest Hopefully, this ride was short enough that no meal was served:
© YouTube We've seen drunk guys with less wobble than this landing in Madeira, Portugal :
© YouTube/Flávio Silva Have we mentioned how windy Birmingham is?
© YouTube/flugsnug Finally, the crap-my-pants award goes to this real-life superhero pilot in Hamburg, Germany:

Kudos to you, German Super Man.
